data.enText: tougher
toughest
difficult
having or causing problems or difficulties
a tough childhood
It was a tough decision to make.

data.chText: 她最近的日子一直很难熬。
data.enText: She's been having a tough time of it (= a lot of problems) lately.

data.chText: 他面临迄今为止对自己的领导工作最严峻的考验。
data.enText: He faces the toughest test of his leadership so far.

data.chText: 要事业家庭两不误，有时会很艰难。
data.enText: It can be tough trying to juggle a career and a family.
strict/firm
demanding that particular rules be obeyed and showing a lack of sympathy for any problems or suffering that this may cause

data.chText: 别对他要求过严，他只是想帮忙。
data.enText: Don't be too tough on him─he was only trying to help.

data.chText: 现在教师该对横行霸道的学生开始采取严厉措施了。
data.enText: It's about time teachers started to get tough with bullies.

data.chText: 学校对作弊行为的惩罚很严厉。
data.enText: The school takes a tough line on (= punishes severely) cheating.
strong

data.chText: 坚强的；健壮的；能吃苦耐劳的；坚韧不拔的
data.enText: strong enough to deal successfully with difficult conditions or situations
a tough breed of cattle

data.chText: 他干推销这一行缺少足够的韧劲。
data.enText: He's not tough enough for a career in sales.
She's a tough cookie/customer (= sb who knows what they want and is not easily influenced by other people) .
physically strong and likely to be violent

data.chText: 你以为自己够厉害的，是不是？
data.enText: You think you're so tough, don't you?
He plays the tough guy in the movie.
meat

data.chText: 难切开的；嚼不烂的；老的
data.enText: difficult to cut or chew
not easily damaged

data.chText: 坚固的；不易切开（或打破、撕破等）的
data.enText: not easily cut, broken, torn, etc.
a tough pair of shoes

data.chText: 这种爬行动物的皮肤坚韧并带有鳞片。
data.enText: The reptile's skin is tough and scaly.
unfortunate
unfortunate for sb in a way that seems unfair

data.chText: 她就这样被队里刷了下来，真是倒霉。
data.enText: It was tough on her being dropped from the team like that.
‘I can't get it finished in time.’ ‘Tough! (= I don't feel sorry about it.) ’
(as) tough as old boots
(as) tough as nails

data.chText: 很强壮；坚韧不拔；雷打不动
data.enText: very strong and able to deal successfully with difficult conditions or situations
not feeling or showing any emotion
tough luck
used to show sympathy for sth unfortunate that has happened to sb

data.chText: “我差一分没及格。”“运气真不好。”
data.enText: ‘I failed by one point.’ ‘That's tough luck.’
used to show that you do not feel sorry for sb who has a problem

data.chText: “如果你把车开走，我就出不去了。”“多倒霉啊！”
data.enText: ‘If you take the car, I won't be able to go out.’ ‘Tough luck!’
a hard/tough act to follow
a person who is so good or successful at sth that it will be difficult for anyone else coming after them to be as good or successful
when the going gets tough (the tough get going)

data.chText: 当条件变得艰苦时，当进展变得困难时（隐含有志者更勇往直前之意）
data.enText: when conditions or progress become difficult (strong and determined people work even harder to succeed)
hang tough
to be determined and refuse to change your attitude or ideas
a hard/tough nut

data.chText: 难对付的人；难说服的人
data.enText: a person who is difficult to deal with or to influence
a person who regularly uses violence against other people
tough sth↔out
to stay firm and determined in a difficult situation

data.chText: 你只好硬着头皮撑到底了。
data.enText: You're just going to have to tough it out .

ex.chText: 移动那块大石头很费劲。
ex.enText: Moving that huge stone was difficult.
The poem is difficult to read.

ex.chText: 那所学校的入学考试不难。
ex.enText: The entrance exam of that school was not difficult.

synonyms.bx: 指因需要努力或技巧而难以做成、理解或处理的。

ex.chText: 这项艰巨的工作对他是个很大的挑战。
ex.enText: The arduous task is of great challenge to him.

ex.chText: 6名探险家都完成了穿越沙漠的艰难旅程。
ex.enText: All the 6 adventurers survived the arduous journey through the desert.

synonyms.bx: 尤指在一段时间内需耗费大量体力和精力才能完成的。

ex.enText: He found that it is hard to learn English well.

ex.chText: 很难说哪一个是正确的。
ex.enText: It's hard to say which is right.

ex.chText: 多加练习，我们就能成为一支难以战胜的球队。
ex.enText: More practice will make us a hard team to beat.

synonyms.bx: 指事情不好理解、处理或不容易做的。

ex.chText: 他的公司挺过了艰难的一年。
ex.enText: His company survived a tough year.

ex.chText: 那些难以回答的问题的确让他很难堪。
ex.enText: Those tough questions really embarrassed him.

synonyms.bx: 因存在或将会引发问题等而难以完成或处理的，尤指在情感上难以抉择的。

data.enText: (as) tough as old boots
(as) tough as nails

data.chText: 很强壮；坚韧不拔；雷打不动
data.enText: very strong and able to deal successfully with difficult conditions or situations
not feeling or showing any emotion
tough luck
used to show sympathy for sth unfortunate that has happened to sb

data.chText: “我差一分没及格。”“运气真不好。”
data.enText: ‘I failed by one point.’ ‘That's tough luck.’
used to show that you do not feel sorry for sb who has a problem

data.chText: “如果你把车开走，我就出不去了。”“多倒霉啊！”
data.enText: ‘If you take the car, I won't be able to go out.’ ‘Tough luck!’
a hard/tough act to follow
a person who is so good or successful at sth that it will be difficult for anyone else coming after them to be as good or successful
when the going gets tough (the tough get going)

data.chText: 当条件变得艰苦时，当进展变得困难时（隐含有志者更勇往直前之意）
data.enText: when conditions or progress become difficult (strong and determined people work even harder to succeed)
hang tough
to be determined and refuse to change your attitude or ideas
a hard/tough nut

data.chText: 难对付的人；难说服的人
data.enText: a person who is difficult to deal with or to influence
talk tough (on sth)
to tell people very strongly what you want
tough sth↔out
to stay firm and determined in a difficult situation

data.chText: 你只好硬着头皮撑到底了。
data.enText: You're just going to have to tough it out .

tr: an aggressive and violent young criminal
someone who learned to fight in the streets rather than being formally trained in the sport of boxing
feeling physical discomfort or pain (`tough' is occasionally used colloquially for `bad')
example: he was feeling tough after a restless night
some plastics are as tough as metal

tr: hard to comprehend or solve or believe
example: I faced the knotty problem of what to have for breakfast
the rugged conditions of frontier life
the tough bottoms of his feet

tr: not given to gentleness or sentimentality

value.def: A tough person is strong and determined, and can tolerate difficulty or suffering.

example.ex: He built up a reputation as a tough businessman...
example.tran: 他树立了铁面生意人的名声。

example.ex: She is tough and ambitious.
example.tran: 她坚韧顽强，满怀抱负。

value.tran: 坚强的;吃苦耐劳的;坚韧不拔的

example.ex: Mrs Potter has won a reputation for toughness and determination on her way to the top.
example.tran: 波特夫人在奋斗到上层的过程中赢得了坚韧和果敢的声誉。

value.def: If you describe someone as tough, you mean that they are rough and violent.

example.ex: He had shot three people dead earning himself a reputation as a tough guy.
example.tran: 他因枪杀三人得到了暴徒的恶名。

example.ex: Three burly toughs elbowed their way to the front.
example.tran: 三个膀粗腰圆的恶汉挤到了前面。

value.def: A tough place or area is considered to have a lot of crime and violence.

example.ex: She doesn't seem cut out for this tough neighbourhood...
example.tran: 她似乎不适合在这个治安恶劣的社区生活。

example.ex: Arthur grew up in a tough city.
example.tran: 阿瑟在一个到处是暴力与犯罪的城市长大。

value.tran: 治安很差的；充满犯罪与暴力的

value.def: A tough way of life or period of time is difficult or full of suffering.

example.ex: She had a pretty tough childhood…
example.tran: 她的童年非常不幸。

example.ex: It's been a tough day…
example.tran: 这是难熬的一天。

example.ex: He was having a really tough time at work.
example.tran: 他当时工作上困难重重。

value.def: A tough task or problem is difficult to do or solve.

example.ex: It was a very tough decision but we feel we made the right one...
example.tran: 这是个困难的决定，但是我们认为我们做出了正确的选择。

example.ex: Whoever wins the election is going to have a tough job getting the economy back on its feet…
example.tran: 不管是谁赢得选举都将面对复苏经济的棘手任务。

example.ex: It may be tough to raise cash…
example.tran: 筹措现金可能不好办。

example.ex: Change is often tough to deal with.
example.tran: 变化总是很难应对。

gramarinfo.label: oft <l>it</l> v-link ADJ to-inf, ADJ to-inf

value.tran: 棘手的;难办的;难解决的

value.def: Tough policies or actions are strict and firm.

example.ex: He is known for taking a tough line on security...
example.tran: 他因在安全问题上采取强硬路线而闻名。

example.ex: He announced tough measures to limit the money supply.
example.tran: 他公布了限制货币供应的严厉措施。

value.def: A tough substance is strong, and difficult to break, cut, or tear.

example.ex: In industry, diamond can form a tough, non-corrosive coating for tools.
example.tran: 在工业上，金刚石可以用作工具表面坚固、耐腐蚀的覆盖层。

example.ex: …dark brown beans with a rather tough outer skin.
example.tran: 有着相当坚韧外壳的深棕色豆类

value.def: Tough meat is difficult to cut and chew.

example.ex: The steak was tough and the peas were like bullets.
example.tran: 牛排老得嚼不动，豌豆像子弹一样硬。

value.tran: (肉)非常老的，切不下的，嚼不动的

value.def: If someone who is trying to achieve something hangs tough, they remain determined and do not give up, even when there are difficulties or problems.

example.ex: The White House is hanging tough for a good agreement to be reached.
example.tran: 白宫为达成一项有利协议寸步不让。

trans: 挺过去；咬紧牙关挺过去；坚持到底
不动感情的人;不易受伤害的人；硬汉
严厉的爱(为帮助而严厉对待有问题的人)
